source_sentence: 異出菩薩本起經一卷
translation: One Fascicle of the Sutra on the Original Production of the Bodhisattva Who Came into Being

source_sentence: 西晉居士聶道真譯
translation: Translated by Nie Daochen, a Layman of the Western Jìn Dynasty

source_sentence: 釋迦文佛，前世宿命為人時，在夫婁多摩國，世世為善，無數世乃得為佛。
translation: When he was born a human being in a prior life, Śākyamuni Buddha stayed in the country of Froṭṭāma and did good deeds from generation to generation, and he became a buddha in countless lifetimes.

source_sentence: 佛為菩薩時，名摩納，居山中，衣鹿皮衣。
translation: When the Buddha became a bodhisattva, his name was Manas, and he lived in the mountains, wearing deerskin clothing.

source_sentence: 時入城，城名鉢摩訶，王名耆耶。
translation: He then entered a city named Pramahā, and the king's name was Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 菩薩見城中怱怱，因問道中行者言：「今日城中，何以怱怱？」
translation: When the bodhisattva saw how hurried the city was, he asked a practitioner on the road, "Why is the city hurried today?"

source_sentence: 行人對言：「佛今日當來！」
translation: The practitioner says, "The Buddha will come today!"

source_sentence: 菩薩聞佛當來到，內獨心喜口言：「今日見佛來者，欲從佛求我心中所欲願者。」
translation: When the bodhisattva heard that the Buddha was about to arrive, he rejoiced alone in his heart and said, "Today, I want to ask the Buddha to grant me the wish of my heart."

source_sentence: 須臾有一女人，名曰俱夷，持應水瓶，有華七枚，華名優鉢。
translation: A moment later, there was a woman named Kauṇḍinya who was carrying a flask of water with seven flowers named Upāya.

source_sentence: 菩薩隨而呼之曰：「大姊且止！」
translation: The bodhisattva then called out to her, "Stop, big sister!"

source_sentence: 俱夷即止待之。
translation: Kauṣṭhila then stopped and waited for him.

source_sentence: 菩薩言：「請夫人手中優鉢華。」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "Please, ma'am, put a superior flower in your hand."

source_sentence: 俱夷言：「今日佛當來到，大王在浴室，我當以華上之，華不可得！」
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "Today, when the Buddha arrives and the great king is in the bath, I'll put flowers on it, but they won't be available!"

source_sentence: 菩薩言：「雇華百錢。」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "Hire flowers for a hundred coins."

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「華不可得！」
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "Flowers are unobtainable!"

source_sentence: 菩薩曰：「可自更取。」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "You can take it from yourself."

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「不可得！」
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "It's unobtainable!"

source_sentence: 菩薩復言：「雇華五百錢。」
translation: The bodhisattva again said, "Hire a flower for 500 coins."

source_sentence: 俱夷心自念：「此華纔直兩三錢，今乃雇五百錢。」
translation: Kauṣṭhila thought to himself, "This flower costs just two or three coins, but now I've hired it for five hundred coins."

source_sentence: 便以優鉢華五枚與之，俱夷自留二枚。
translation: He then gave him five of the blue lotus flowers and Kauṣṭhila kept two for himself.

source_sentence: 菩薩探懷中齎錢，適得五百，盡以與之，各自別去。
translation: The bodhisattva looked into his pocket and carried five hundred coins, so he gave them all to him and left separately.

source_sentence: 俱夷心念言：「此道人，衣鹿皮衣耳，適有五百銀錢，盡用雇華，疑此非恒人也。」
translation: Kublai thought to himself, "This Taoist man is wearing a deerskin robe, and he has 500 coins and uses all the flowers he can get.

source_sentence: 即隨而呼之曰：「男子，男子！
translation: He then called out to him, "Man, man!

source_sentence: 且止！」
translation: Stop!"

source_sentence: 菩薩即止待之。
translation: The bodhisattva then stopped and waited for him.

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「卿以誠告我，我以華與卿；不者，我奪卿華去。」
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "If you tell me sincerely, I'll give you flowers; if not, I'll take your flowers and leave."

source_sentence: 菩薩言：「我買華，從百錢上至五百，何故奪我華？」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "I've bought flowers from a hundred coins up to five hundred, so why would you take my flowers?"

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「此華王家華，我力勢能奪卿。」
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "This is the flower of the king's household, and I have the strength to take it from you."

source_sentence: 菩薩即以誠告之：「我聞佛今日當來到，欲以華上之，從佛求心中所欲願者。」
translation: The bodhisattva then told him with sincerity, "I've heard that the Buddha will come today, and I want to offer it up as a flower to seek from him what my heart desires."

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「大善！
translation: Kauṇḍinya said, "That's very good!

source_sentence: 願我後生，為卿作婦，卿後生好惡者，我當為卿作婦，必置我心，令佛知之。」
translation: May I be a wife to you in a later life, and I will be a wife to you in a later life if you're good or evil, and I will put my mind to it so that the Buddha will know it."

source_sentence: 菩薩曰：「可！」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 便以手中華二枚，與菩薩令上佛。
translation: He then gave the bodhisattva two flowers in his hand and asked him to go up to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 俱夷言：「婦人不能得前，願以華累卿。」
translation: Kauṇḍinya said, "A woman who can't go up there would like to offer you flowers."

source_sentence: 菩薩便受之，各自別去。
translation: The bodhisattva then accepted them and departed separately.

source_sentence: 須臾佛來到，國王以下至萬民，皆以百種雜華，散佛頭上，華皆墮地。
translation: In a moment, when the Buddha arrived, the king down to ten thousand people scattered a hundred different kinds of flowers on the Buddha's head, and they all fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 菩薩持華五枚，散佛頭上，華皆留止，上向成行，如根生不墮地；菩薩持俱夷華，散佛頭上，華復留止，上向成行，在兩肩不墮地，佛知菩薩至心。
translation: The bodhisattva took five flowers and scattered them on the Buddha's head, where they all remained, went upward in rows, and didn't fall to the ground like a root growing; the bodhisattva took the kuṣya flower and scattered it on the Buddha's head, where it again remained, went upward in rows, and didn't fall to the ground on either shoulder.

source_sentence: 佛言：「令汝得心中所欲願者，却後九十劫，劫名拔羅，汝當為釋迦文佛。」
translation: The Buddha said, "If you attain the wish in your heart, then in the next 90 eons, the eons will be called Bālā, and you will become Śākyamuni Buddha."

source_sentence: 菩薩聞佛語，心中大歡喜，即布髮令佛足蹈之，故立於佛前踊躍，佛以神接之，即去地四丈九尺，無所播持，從上來下。
translation: When the bodhisattva heard what the Buddha said, his heart rejoiced greatly, and he spread his hair so that the Buddha's feet would touch it.

source_sentence: 佛復言：「令汝後世得道度世，亦當如我作佛。」
translation: The Buddha then said, "May you attain enlightenment and save the world in a later life, and you will also become a buddha like me."

source_sentence: 是時佛者先世佛，號曰題惒竭羅佛！
translation: That was the Buddha from a prior life, called Tītakauśalya Buddha!

source_sentence: 佛般泥洹去，菩薩還入山中，壽終以後，即上生第二忉利天上，諸天皆共護視；天上壽盡，即復來下生鳩夷那竭國，為飛行皇帝，主四天下；壽終即復上生第二忉利天上，作帝釋。
translation: After the Buddha's parinirvāṇa departure and the bodhisattva's return to the mountain, he was born up in the second heaven of the Thirty-three heavens, where the gods all guarded him; when his life in heaven was up, he was again born down in the country of Kauśinagara, where he became an emperor of flight and ruled the four worlds; when his life ended, he was again born up in the second heaven of the Thirty-three heavens and became an emperor-principal.

source_sentence: 如是終而復始，凡三十六為天帝釋，八萬四千世為飛行皇帝。
translation: Thus, from end to end and beginning to beginning, he'll be an emperor in 36 heavens and an emperor of flight for 84,000 lifetimes.

source_sentence: 如是壽終以後，即上生第四兜率天上，即復下生迦維羅衛國。
translation: After thus ending his life, he then goes up to the fourth Tuṣita Heaven and is again born down in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 迦維羅衛國者，天地之中央也；佛生者，不可邊土餘國，地為之傾側。
translation: Kapilavastu is the central part of heaven and earth, and when the Buddha is born, he can't be born in another country in a border land that tilts the earth to its side.

source_sentence: 迦維羅衛國王，為人仁賢，即下入王夫人腹中，但有不淨故，無所附近。
translation: The king of Kapilavastu, a kind and virtuous man, then descends into the womb of the king's wife, but there's nothing near him because he's impure.

source_sentence: 左右群臣，及隣國請可屬迦維羅衛國者，聞王夫人有娠，皆來賀大王，前為夫人作禮。
translation: When the ministers and other officials from neighboring states who had asked to be part of Kapilavastu heard that the king's wife was pregnant, they all came to congratulate the king and pay homage to her.

source_sentence: 太子從腹中見外人，如蒙羅縠中視見外人；外人作禮，太子於腹中，以手攘之。
translation: The crown prince sees an outsider from his belly as he sees an outsider covered in silk; when the outsider makes obeisance, the crown prince swipes him away with his hand while he's still in the womb.

source_sentence: 所以攘之者何？
translation: What was the reason he shook them off?

source_sentence: 不欲煩擾天下人也。
translation: "She doesn't want to disturb the people of the world.

source_sentence: 夫人懷抱太子時，天上諸神，日持天上飯食，來置夫人前，夫人不知飯食所從來？
translation: When the madam was carrying the prince, the gods in heaven brought food from heaven every day and placed it in front of the madam, but she didn't know where it came from.

source_sentence: 不能復食王家飯食，王家飯食，苦且辛。
translation: He couldn't eat the food of the king's household again, which was painful and hard.

source_sentence: 太子以四月八日夜半時生，從母右脇生墮地，行七步之中，舉足高四寸，足不蹈地，即復舉右手言：「天上天下，尊無過我者！」
translation: On the eighth day of the fourth month, at midnight, the prince was born at his mother's right hypochondrium and fell to the ground. He took seven steps, lifted his feet four inches high, and didn't touch the ground with his feet, then raised his right hand again and said, "There's no one higher than me in heaven or on earth!"

source_sentence: 四天王即來下作禮，抱持太子，置黃金机上，和湯浴形，王與夫人、左右皆驚。
translation: The four heavenly kings then descended to pay their respects, carried the prince in their arms, placed him on a golden potion, and bathed his body in hot water.

source_sentence: 太子生時，上至三十三天下至十六泥犁，傍行八極，萬二千天地，皆為大明，天地為之振動，乃下為兒。
translation: When the prince was born, the Trāyastriṃśa gods and the sixteen nirayas that circle the eight extremities and the twelve thousand heavens and earth became great in light, and heaven and earth were shaken by it.

source_sentence: 其乳母，以[疊*毛]布囊授其母，即亦自乳養，名為悉達。
translation: His wet nurse gives his mother a [heaped*hair] cloth bag, which she then nurses herself, and she's called Siddhârtha.

source_sentence: 悉達生身，有三十二相。
translation: Siddhârtha's body was born with thirty-two marks.

source_sentence: 明日，王與夫人議：「吾子生不與人同，國中有大道人，年百餘歲，大工相人，字為阿夷，寧可俱行相太子。」
translation: On the morrow, the king and his wife discussed, "My son was not born like other people; there's a great man of the road in our country who's more than a hundred years old and a great expert in facial expressions, whose name is Aji, so why don't we both practice facial expressions as a prince?"

source_sentence: 夫人曰：「大善！」
translation: The lady said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 王與夫人，共行到道人所，王以黃金一囊，白銀一囊，以上道人，道人不受金銀，即開[疊*毛]布而視之。
translation: The king and his wife traveled together to the Daoist. The king gave the Daoist a bag of gold and a bag of silver, but the Daoist didn't accept the gold or silver.

source_sentence: 太子有三十二相，神光表現，道人即垂泣而悲。
translation: The prince had thirty-two marks and a brilliant appearance, and the Daoist man was overcome with tears and compassion.

source_sentence: 王夫人問：「道人！
translation: Mrs. Wang asked, "Master Taoist!

source_sentence: 吾子將有何不善耶？
translation: Won't my son be good?

source_sentence: 王今日故相太子，欲知善惡，何以故悲泣？」
translation: Today, the king therefore wants to know about the good and evil in the prince's presence; why is he so sad and weeping?"

source_sentence: 道人曰：「昨日天地振動，正為太子！
translation: The Daoist said, "Yesterday, the heavens and earth shook, and it was the Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 我傷年老，今我當去世，恨不待此人，恨不聞是人經戒，以故悲泣。」
translation: I'm sad and old, and now that I'm going to die, I wish I hadn't waited for this person, and I wish I hadn't heard about this person's sūtras and precepts; that's why I'm sad and weep."

source_sentence: 王聞道人所言，即為太子，選擇國中名倡妓，得四千人，令千人一番歌樂，晝夜不休息。
translation: When the king heard what the Daoist said, he chose for the crown prince a famous courtesan in the country, obtaining 4,000 of them and making a thousand of them sing and play together day and night without resting.

source_sentence: 又欲宿衛太子，王深知道人工相人，王即為太子，更治宮室門戶垣墻，皆令完堅，若欲開之，持門戶者，其聲當聞四十里中。
translation: He also wanted to guard the crown prince, and the king knew well the man who made him. The king then made the palace gates and walls complete and strong for the crown prince, so that if he wanted to open them, the sound of someone holding the gates and walls would be heard for 40 miles.

source_sentence: 太子生時，殿中有倉頭亦生，有一白馬亦生，倉頭名車匿，馬名曰鞬德，王令倉頭侍太子馬，為太子養護，當乘騎之。
translation: When the crown prince was born, a storeroom manager in the palace also gave birth, and so did a white horse named Chandaka and a horse named Hyde. The king told the storeroom manager to serve the crown prince's horse and nurture it for the crown prince, who would ride it.

source_sentence: 太子生七日，其母終矣。
translation: Seven days after the prince's birth, his mother died.

source_sentence: 太子年十歲，前白大王：「為王太子，未曾出遊。」
translation: When the prince was ten years old, he said to the king, "As the king's prince, I've never traveled."

source_sentence: 王曰：「大善！」
translation: The king said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 即令左右百官，隨太子行遊。
translation: He ordered his entourage of officials to accompany the prince on his journey.

source_sentence: 太子乘車，出東城門，第二忉利天王釋，即化作病疾人在前，腹大身腫，肌肉盡索，著壁而息。
translation: As he rode out of the eastern city gate, the second king of the Heaven of Thirty-one, Śākyamuni, appeared in front of him as a sick man with a large belly and swollen body, his muscles completely torn, and he was resting against a wall.

source_sentence: 太子問其馭者：「是何等人？」
translation: The crown prince asked his harnesser, "What kind of person is this?"

source_sentence: 馭者對曰：「是病疾人。」
translation: The barker replied, "This is a sick and ill person."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「何如為病疾人？」
translation: The prince said, "How is he a sick and ill person?"

source_sentence: 馭者對曰：「是人宿命為惡，今生為人，食飲不節，臥起無常，中得為病。」
translation: The ruler replied, "That person's past life was evil, and he was born a human being in this life who eats and drinks uncontrollably, lies down and rises impermanently, and becomes ill in the interim."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「吾國王之子！
translation: The prince said, "My king's son!

source_sentence: 飲食不節，臥起無常，當復得是病？」
translation: When you don't eat and drink with restraint and don't get up at bedtime, will you again get this disease?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人皆當得是。」
translation: The commander said, "Everyone will get this."

source_sentence: 太子即迴車而還，愁憂不樂，念：「天下人悉當病，今我當復病，不復飲食。」
translation: The prince then returned to his chariot, became sad and unhappy, and thought, "Everyone in the world must be ill; now I will become ill again and won't eat or drink again."

source_sentence: 大王悔令太子出遊，復閉宮門，不復使出，還作倡妓樂之，太子甫愁憂益劇，不能飲食，至後稍稍差。
translation: The king regretted allowing the prince to travel, closed the palace door again, stopped him from leaving, and created a courtesan to entertain him.

source_sentence: 復數年所，太子復報大王：「今在宮中閉日久，思樂復一出遊。」
translation: A few more years later, the prince again reported to the king, "Now that I've been shut up in the palace for a long time, I'd like to go out again."

source_sentence: 大王不忍逆太子意，復可之，豫令國中：「太子當出，勿令病人諸不淨潔在道傍。」
translation: The king couldn't bear to disobey the prince and approved, ordering the king to tell the people of his country, "The prince must go out and not allow patients with impure and unclean conditions to stay near the road."

source_sentence: 皆勅令太子復乘車出南城門。
translation: They all commanded the prince to ride out of the southern city gates again.

source_sentence: 天王釋，復化作熱病人，頭面不理，屎尿相塗，還自臥其上，命在呼吸。
translation: The king of gods released him and then turned him into a feverish patient with his head and face unattached, smeared with feces and urine, who was still lying on his back, breathing his last breath.

source_sentence: 太子問馭者：「是何等人？」
translation: The prince asked the bugger, "What kind of person is this?"

source_sentence: 馭者對曰：「是人宿命為惡，不肯自剋，飲食不節，臥起無常，中得是病，命在須臾。」
translation: The ruler replied, "That person's past life was evil, and they refuse to control themselves. They don't eat and drink with restraint and don't get up regularly when lying down.

source_sentence: 太子曰：「吾亦飲食不節，臥起無常，當得此病？」
translation: The prince said, "I also don't eat and drink with restraint, and I get up unpredictably when I lie down; will I get this disease?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人皆當病。」
translation: The commander said, "Everyone must be ill."

source_sentence: 太子即復迴車而還，太子復愁憂，不肯飲食。
translation: The prince then returned to his chariot, but he was again sad and refused to eat.

source_sentence: 大王曰：「傍臣左右，故先勅令國中，勿令病人諸不淨潔者當太子，何故令病人見太子？」
translation: The king said, "I've ordered the kingdom not to allow sick people or impure people to be crown princes because I've been around ministers, so why did you allow sick people to see the crown prince?"

source_sentence: 後為作倡妓樂太子，太子愁不解，不以樂為樂，後稍差。
translation: He then created a courtesan to entertain the prince, but he couldn't understand his worries and didn't consider it a pleasure.

source_sentence: 稍差後，復數年所，太子復報大王：「閉其宮中不樂，復欲出遊。」
translation: After he got better, he went back to his palace for a few years, and the prince again reported to the king, "He was shut up in his palace and wasn't happy, and he wanted to go on another excursion."

source_sentence: 王曰：「汝一出來，還常愁憂不樂，不欲復飲食，何為復出遊耶？」
translation: The king said, "As soon as you left, you were still sad and unhappy and didn't want to eat or drink again, so why did you go on another excursion?"

source_sentence: 太子曰：「我不復爾。」
translation: The prince said, "I won't do that again."

source_sentence: 王復令國中：「太子欲出遊，勿令病人諸不淨潔當道見。」
translation: The king then ordered the kingdom, "If the prince wishes to travel, don't let the patients see him in the road in an impure and clean way."

source_sentence: 太子乘車，出西城門。
translation: The crown prince rode out of the western city gate in his chariot.

source_sentence: 天王釋，復化作一老人，羸瘦背傴，拄杖而行。
translation: The king then released him and transformed him into an old man with a thin, bony back and a walking stick.

source_sentence: 太子問馭者：「是何等人？」
translation: The prince asked the horseman, "What kind of man is this?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「是老人。」
translation: The barker said, "It's an old man."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「何如為老人？」
translation: The prince said, "How can I be an old man?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人生地上，從年一至竟，壽命欲盡，氣力衰微，飲食不能，故曰老人。」
translation: The ruler said, "On earth, people are called old people when their lives are about to end, their energy weakens, and they can't eat or drink."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「吾亦當復老耶？」
translation: The prince said, "How old will I be?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人生皆當老。」
translation: The harnesser said, "All of us will grow old."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「迴車而還，吾亦不久居世間。」
translation: The prince said, "After turning back in my chariot, I won't be long in the world."

source_sentence: 便復大憂：「人皆當復老衰微，飲食消盡，當終亡，我何為久於世間？」
translation: He then became greatly concerned, "Everyone will grow old and decrepit, their diet will be gone, and they will die, so why should I stay in the world for a long time?"

source_sentence: 不肯復飲食，愁憂低頭。
translation: He wouldn't eat again and hung his head in sorrow.

source_sentence: 大王復誘恤諫曉：「我獨有汝一子耳，當持國付汝，奈何一出，還輙愁憂，不肯飲食。」
translation: The king then encouraged and advised him, "I have only one son in you, and I will entrust the kingdom to you; why is it that as soon as you leave, you become sad and reluctant to eat?"

source_sentence: 王大為作樂樂之，後復稍稍解。
translation: The king made a great effort to cheer him up, but then he was slightly relieved.

source_sentence: 如是久久後，復報王：「我欲出遊。」
translation: After a long time like that, he again reported to the king, "I want to go on a journey."

source_sentence: 王答言：「汝一出來，還輙愁憂不樂，不肯飲食，發痟瘦，從死還，何為復欲出遊？」
translation: The king answered, "As soon as you leave, you'll return, become sad and unhappy, refuse to eat, become thin and hairy, and return from death; why do you want to travel again?"

source_sentence: 太子曰：「我年長大當老。」
translation: The prince said, "I'll grow old when I'm older."

source_sentence: 王復遣出北城門，天王釋，復化作喪車，中外男女，持幡啼哭，隨車而送之。
translation: The king then sent him out the northern gate, where the god king released him and transformed him into a funeral chariot, and men and women from both inside and outside the country carrying banners and wailing followed him there.

source_sentence: 太子問其馭者：「是何等人聲？」
translation: The prince asked his harnesser, "What kind of human voice is that?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「是哭聲。」
translation: The monk said, "It's the sound of weeping."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「何如為哭聲？」
translation: The prince said, "What's the sound of weeping?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「有人死者。」
translation: The barker said, "A man has died."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「何如為死？」
translation: The prince said, "How is it possible for someone to die?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人生地上，懸命在天，壽有長短，故曰死；死者無所復知，身體皆消盡，終無有期，家室哀痛，隨而送之。」
translation: The monk said, "Man lives on earth, his life hangs in the balance, and his life span is long and short, which is why it's called death; the dead know nothing further, their bodies are all gone, and there's no expiration date; their families grieve and send them off."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「吾亦當死耶？」
translation: The prince said, "Shall I die, too?"

source_sentence: 馭者曰：「人皆當歸死。」
translation: The ruler said, "All people will return to death."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「吾不能久居天地之間，吾當復是死。」
translation: The prince said, "I can't stay between heaven and earth for long; I'll die again."

source_sentence: 遂迴車而還。
translation: He then turned back in his chariot and returned.

source_sentence: 王問馭者：「太子還何以疾？」
translation: The king asked the harness man, "How did the prince return because of his illness?"

source_sentence: 左右白言：「太子出遊，道見喪車，心為不樂，故還疾。」
translation: His attendants said, "The prince went on a tour and saw a funeral chariot on the road. He was upset and returned home."

source_sentence: 王曰：「吾亦不欲令太子出遊。」
translation: The king said, "I don't want the crown prince to go on a journey either."

source_sentence: 太子年二十，王欲為太子娶婦。
translation: When the crown prince was twenty years old, the king wanted to marry the crown prince.

source_sentence: 太子曰：「我不娶婦。」
translation: The crown prince said, "I won't marry a woman."

source_sentence: 王為太子，閱一國中女，得數十萬女，令太子目閱視之訖，無有可太子意者，最後一女，名曰俱夷，太子曰：「吾欲娶是女。」
translation: The king examined the women of a country for the crown prince and found hundreds of thousands of them. After he had examined them, the crown prince found none to his liking.

source_sentence: 王即為太子娶之。
translation: The king then married her for the crown prince.

source_sentence: 為太子娶婦，是女平生可持華賣與菩薩者，宿命時，字俱夷，今生續字俱夷。
translation: He gave the crown prince a wife who could have carried flowers in her ordinary life and sold them to the bodhisattvas, whose name was Kukki in her previous life and whose name is Kukki in her present life.

source_sentence: 太子謂婦曰：「我兩人，同床併首，願得好華，置我兩人間共視，亦好耶？」
translation: The prince said to the woman, "Would it be better if we were to share a bed and head together and wish to have nice flowers to look at between us?"

source_sentence: 其婦曰：「華可得。」
translation: The woman said, "The flowers are obtainable."

source_sentence: 即取華置中央，夫妻俠之臥。
translation: She then took the flower, put it in the center, and the couple lay down with it.

source_sentence: 婦人之意，欲附太子，太子固謂婦言：「若來附我，必迫此華，此華有汁，流污床席。」
translation: The woman's intention was to attach herself to the prince, but the prince assured her, "If you come to attach yourself to me, you'll have to force this flower, which has juice that will stain your bed and seat."

source_sentence: 其婦即自却。
translation: The woman then turned herself away.

source_sentence: 久久復謂婦言：「我兩人，同床併首，願欲得好[疊*毛]布，置我兩人中央顧視之，不亦好耶？」
translation: After a long time, he again said to her, "Wouldn't it be nice if we both shared the same bed and head, and wished to have a nice [heaped*hair] cloth to put between us and look at?"

source_sentence: 婦曰：「[疊*毛]布可得。」
translation: The woman said, "[A pile of *hair] can be spread out."

source_sentence: 即取[疊*毛]布置中央。
translation: She then took the [pile of *hair] and arranged it in the center.

source_sentence: 婦人之意，意欲身前近太子，太子曰：「若來附我，必有汗垢污[疊*毛]布。」
translation: The woman's intention was to approach the prince herself, but he said, "If you come near me, you'll get dirt and sweat on the [heaped*hair] cloth."

source_sentence: 其婦即却，不敢大親太子，意疑太子，坐起常隨太子。
translation: The woman then withdrew, didn't dare to become intimate with the prince, had doubts about him, and sat up and always followed him.

source_sentence: 夜半時，四天王，從天窓中來，呼太子曰：「時到可去。」
translation: At midnight, four celestial kings came from a celestial window and summoned the prince, saying, "The time has come for you to leave."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「我欲去，不能得去。」
translation: The prince said, 'I want to go, but I can't.'

source_sentence: 四天王，即令舞歌者伏鞞瞑，無所復知。
translation: The four heavenly kings then caused the dancers and singers to subdue him and close their eyes, not knowing any further.

source_sentence: 其婦臥出，太子徐據床，起視其婦，恐婦覺知，太子遂下床而起得去。
translation: When the woman emerged from her bed, the prince slowly moved to the bed and got up to look at the woman, lest she realize it.

source_sentence: 徐呼同日所生倉頭車匿，令鞴白馬鞬德於中庭。
translation: He then summoned Chandaka, who had been born on the same day, and told him to saddle a white horse, the Quetzalude, in the courtyard.

source_sentence: 車匿即鞴馬，太子上馬欲去，恐門有聲故，徘徊中庭，太子馬行，蹄聲常聞二十里，是門聲聞四十里故，太子不敢開門。
translation: When the prince mounted his horse and wanted to leave, he was afraid of the sound of the door, so he wandered into the courtyard.

source_sentence: 四天王，即使諸鬼神，抱持馬足，踰屋出城，自到王家佃上，止樹下。
translation: The four celestial kings and their demons took the horse's feet, passed through the house and out of the city, went to the king's tenant house, and stayed under a tree.

source_sentence: 明日，王不知太子所在，宮中騷動，王曰：「吾子未曾出遊，今且在佃舍耳。」
translation: On the morrow, the king didn't know where the prince was, and there was a commotion in the palace. The king said, "My son has never traveled, so now he's in the tenement."

source_sentence: 王即自到佃舍，遙見太子坐樹下，日光欲照太子，樹曲其枝葉扇之，不得令日光照太子。
translation: The king then went to the tenement himself and saw the prince sitting under a tree, and when the sun wanted to shine on him, the tree bent its branches and leaves to fan him, but he couldn't let the sun shine on him.

source_sentence: 王恐心且惶，下馬為太子作禮，太子亦為王作禮，太子曰：「我為王作子，未曾出遊，今一出遊，今王復追我，我馬與奴，續在一傍，願大王歸宮，我數日自歸。」
translation: The king was afraid and frightened, so he dismounted from his horse and paid homage to the prince, who paid homage to the king. The prince said, "I've never traveled since I was a son of the king, but now that I've traveled, the king is chasing me again.

source_sentence: 王即上馬而歸，謂其婦俱夷：「太子今在佃上，數日來歸。」
translation: The king then mounted his horse and returned, telling his wife Kauṇḍinya, "The prince is now on a tenant farm, and he'll come back in a few days."

source_sentence: 太子在樹下，專精長思惟累劫之事，上至三十三天，下至十六泥犁，無一可者；見田中犁者，出土中蟲，或有傷者，或有死者，烏復隨而食之，太子歎曰：「人生地上，死當入泥犁，不亦苦乎！
translation: When the prince was under a tree, he concentrated his thoughts on the deeds of eons, from the Trāyastriṃśa gods down to the sixteen mud plows, none of which were acceptable, and saw worms in the soil, some injured, and some dead, emerging from the plows in the fields, and crows following them and eating them, the prince praised him, saying, "Isn't it painful to be born on the earth and die in a mud plow?

source_sentence: 吾不能久居世間。」
translation: I can't stay in the world for long."

source_sentence: 即上馬而去。
translation: He then mounted his horse and departed.

source_sentence: 行十數里，見一男子，名曰賁識，賁識者，鬼神中大神，為人剛憋；左手持弓，右手持箭，腰帶利劍，當道而立。
translation: After traveling a few dozen miles, he saw a man named Benji, who's a great spirit among ghosts and spirits, a rigid supporter of people, holding a bow in his left hand, an arrow in his right hand, and a sharp sword at his waist, standing in the middle of the road.

source_sentence: 賁識所立處者有三道，一者天道，二者人道，三者泥犁惡人之道。
translation: There are three paths where Ben Consciousness stands: one is the path of gods, two are the paths of humans, and three are the paths of evil people in Nirvana.

source_sentence: 太子遙見，心為不樂，直以馬前趣之。
translation: When the prince sees this from a distance, his mind is displeased, and he directly approaches him on horseback.

source_sentence: 賁識即惶怖戰慄，解劍持弓箭，却路而立。
translation: Benshi then became frightened and frightened, untied his sword, took his bow and arrow, and withdrew from the path to stand.

source_sentence: 太子問曰：「何道可從？」
translation: The prince asked, "What path can I follow?"

source_sentence: 賁識即以天道示之：「此道可從。」
translation: Benji then showed him the way of heaven, "This is a path to follow."

source_sentence: 太子行數十里，道逢獵者，太子曰：「我欲從卿有所債，寧可得耶？」
translation: When he met a hunter on the road after traveling several dozen miles, the prince said, "I'd like to follow you for some debt, but how could I get it?"

source_sentence: 獵者言：「所索者可得。」
translation: The hunter said, "I'll get what I'm asking for."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「欲得君鹿皮。」
translation: The prince said, "I want to get the skin of your deer."

source_sentence: 獵者即以皮與太子，太子亦以珍物與之。
translation: The hunter then gave the skin to the prince, and the prince gave him some valuable things.

source_sentence: 太子行數十里，駐馬而下，謂車匿：「若從是而還。」
translation: The prince traveled several dozen miles, stopped his horse, and got down, saying to Chandaka, "Suppose you return from this."

source_sentence: 車匿言：「我隨大天，不可還。」
translation: Chandaka said, "I followed the Mahādeva and can't return."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「歸謝大王及我舍妻，言我欲入山為道，終身不復還。」
translation: The prince said, "I thank the great king and my wife for saying that I want to go into the mountains as a way and never return."

source_sentence: 太子取頭上寶冠無利著身珍衣，授與車匿，車匿啼哭受之；其白馬，前屈膝垂淚，而舐太子足。
translation: The prince took the jeweled crown on his head, which had no profit, and put it on his precious body and robes, and gave it to Chandaka, who wept and accepted it; his white horse bent its knees and wept, and licked the prince's feet.

source_sentence: 車匿步牽馬而還，車匿亦啼，白馬亦啼，從後望太子，取麏鹿皮著之，欲變其服。
translation: When he returned, he also cried, and the white horse also cried. Looking back at the prince, he took a deer hide and put it on, intending to change his clothes.

source_sentence: 婦日望太子當歸，反見空馬，啼哭自投殿下，前抱馬頸，謂車匿：「太子所在？」
translation: She looked from behind at the prince, took a deer skin, put it on, and tried to change his clothes.

source_sentence: 車匿曰：「太子上謝大王及我舍妻，言我入山為道，終身不復還。」
translation: Canaan said, "The prince thanked the king and my wife for giving him up, saying that I had gone into the mountains to become a monk and would never return."

source_sentence: 俱夷曰：「我何薄命！
translation: Kauṣṭhila said, "What a miserable life I've had!

source_sentence: 如亡我夫，我當於何所求？
translation: If my husband were to die, what would I seek?

source_sentence: 我夫我夫！
translation: My husband, my husband!

source_sentence: 在天上地下人間耶？
translation: Is it in heaven or on earth among human beings?

source_sentence: 我當行求之！」
translation: I will practice seeking it!"

source_sentence: 謂白馬言：「太子與汝俱出，若反空還？」
translation: He said to the white horse, "Did the prince go out with you, or did he return empty?"

source_sentence: 左右皆為感動。
translation: His entourage was moved.

source_sentence: 王聞太子去，泣下交橫，謂俱夷：「人生地上，皆當歸死，吾子學道度世，不亦善耶！」
translation: When the king heard that the prince had left, he wept and sobbed profusely, saying to Kui, "All human beings on earth must return to death; wouldn't it be good for my son to train in the way and save the world?"

source_sentence: 欲以解俱夷意，王亦念太子無已。
translation: He wanted to help Kucha understand his thoughts, and the king also remembered that the prince was endless.

source_sentence: 王即請國中賢智之士，得數千人，王復選數千人，得數百人，復於數百人中，得數十人，復於數十人中，選擇得五人。
translation: The king then invited several thousand wise men from his country, selected several thousand, got several hundred, selected several tens of them, and selected five out of several tens.

source_sentence: 王呼五人問言：「卿等日夜於家，抱子持孫，亦獨樂乎？
translation: The king summoned the five men and asked them, "Are you happy at home day and night, holding your children and grandchildren?

source_sentence: 今吾有一子，未曾出遊，不知天下白黑，一旦捨吾，遠處行入名山，涉歷窈林，趣度溪谷，寒暑飢渴，誰當知之？
translation: Now, I have a son who has never traveled before and doesn't know when the world is white and dark. Once he leaves me, he travels far and wide into famous mountains, wades through fair forests, goes to cross streams and valleys, and experiences cold, heat, hunger, and thirst; who would know about that?

source_sentence: 或有虎狼猛獸吉凶之事，誰當見者？
translation: Who should see the fortune of a tiger or a wolf or a fierce animal?

source_sentence: 今卿等五人，各遣一子，追求吾子，得者便隨侍之，吾子終身不復還，卿等五人，有中道捨吾子去之，吾滅卿等家族。」
translation: Now, five of you will each send one of your sons to pursue my son, and whoever gets it will follow him; my son will never return, and if five of you abandon my son on the middle path, I'll annihilate your family."

source_sentence: 五人即遣。
translation: The five of you were then sent away.

source_sentence: 五子追求太子，得之於名山，隨而侍之。
translation: The five sons pursued the prince, found him on a famous mountain, and followed him to wait on him.

source_sentence: 如是數歲，太子亦不問五人所從來，太子所行者，皆窈林之處，五人患而苦之，自相謂言：「是王太子，不行學道，病狂癡耳，行不擇道，我五人不能隨，還者王滅吾家，不如於此而止。」
translation: After several years of this, the prince didn't ask where the five came from, and the place where he went was a fair forest. The five were distressed and distressed, and they said to each other, "The king's prince doesn't practice the path of training, he's crazy and insane, and he's practicing the path of non-selection; the five of us couldn't follow him; the king would destroy our family if we returned, so we might as well stop here."

source_sentence: 五人皆言：「可！」
translation: The five of them all said, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 五人所止處者，大水上，其水上有果蓏異類之物，冬夏常有所噉故不飢，五人止留，太子亦不問也。
translation: The five men stopped at a place on the large river where there were fruits and fruits of various kinds on the water that they could always devour in winter and summer, so they weren't hungry.

source_sentence: 太子遂入深山無人之處，取地高草，於樹下正坐，一心自念言：「今日肌骨筋髓，皆枯腐，於此不得佛不起。」
translation: The prince then went deep into the mountains where there was no one, took some tall grass, sat correctly under a tree, and said with one thought, "Today, my bones and sinews and marrow are withered and rotted, and I won't attain Buddhahood here."

source_sentence: 太子便得一禪，復得二禪，復得三禪，復得四禪。
translation: The prince then attained the first dhyāna, then the second dhyāna, then the third dhyāna, and then the fourth dhyāna.

source_sentence: 便於一夜中，得阿術闍，自知所從何生，無數世時宿命。
translation: In one night, he attained arjaka, knowing for himself where he had been born and his past lives over countless lifetimes.

source_sentence: 二夜時，得第二術闍，得天眼，徹視洞見無極，知人生死所行，趣善惡之道。
translation: During the second night, he attains the second arhatja and attains the divine eye, which sees thoroughly and insightfully and has no limit and knows the courses of human birth and death and the paths to good and evil.

source_sentence: 向明時，便得佛。
translation: As he heads toward the light, he then attains Buddhahood.

source_sentence: 佛自念：「我以得佛矣！
translation: The Buddha thinks to himself, "I've already become a buddha!

source_sentence: 難得難知難了。」
translation: It's difficult to attain, difficult to know, and difficult to understand."

source_sentence: 得佛道，便到龍水所，龍名文隣。
translation: After attaining the Buddha's path, he went to a dragon named Munirinagiri that was near the water.

source_sentence: 文隣者所止水邊有樹，佛便正坐自念言：「昔往無數劫時，有題和竭羅佛言，我當為釋迦文佛，我今日已得佛矣！
translation: There was a tree near the water where that Manninga man stopped, and the Buddha then sat correctly and thought to himself, "In the past, for countless eons, there was the Tathāgata Kiṃśuka Buddha who said, 'I will be the Śākyamuni Buddha, and now I've become a buddha!'

source_sentence: 我從無數劫以來求佛，適今得佛耳！
translation: I've been seeking the Buddha for countless eons, and now I've attained him!

source_sentence: 我從無數劫以來所施，為入六波羅蜜，不忘我功德也，今皆得之。」
translation: The six perfections I've given since uncountable eons, which I won't forget about my virtues, have all been attained now."

source_sentence: 佛適念是，便入禪波羅蜜。
translation: With this in mind, the Buddha then entered the perfection of meditation.

source_sentence: 佛在水邊樹下，坐禪光景入水，徹照龍所居處。
translation: While sitting under a tree near the water's edge, the Buddha's light from meditation entered the water and thoroughly illuminated where the dragon was staying.

source_sentence: 龍見佛光，大驚，毛甲為竪。
translation: When the dragon saw the Buddha's light, he was terrified and his hair and nails stood on end.

source_sentence: 文隣龍曾已更見三佛，一者名拘婁孫佛，二者名拘那含牟尼佛，三者名迦葉佛，皆在樹下坐，光景皆入水中，徹照龍所居處。
translation: Wenlin Long had seen three other buddhas, one named Kulūsuan, the other named Kanakamuni, and the third named Kāśyapa, all sitting under a tree, and their light radiating into the water, penetrating the place where the dragon was staying.

source_sentence: 龍見佛光景如前，三佛光景世間得，無復有佛。
translation: The dragon saw the Buddha's radiance as before, but there was no other Buddha in the world that could have been seen in the radiance of the three Buddhas.

source_sentence: 龍便大喜，出水左右顧視，見佛坐樹下，身有三十二相，正金色，端正如日月。
translation: The dragon then rejoiced greatly and got out of the water to look from side to side. He saw the Buddha sitting under a tree, his body with thirty-two marks, orthodox gold in color, and correct like the sun and moon.

source_sentence: 佛三十二相，遙見如樹有華。
translation: The thirty-two phases of the Buddha were seen from a distance like a tree with flowers.

source_sentence: 文隣龍便前趣佛，繞佛七匝，龍有七頭，便以覆佛上。
translation: Wenlin the dragon then went up to the Buddha and circled him seven times. The dragon had seven heads, which he then placed over the Buddha.

source_sentence: 龍出水侍佛，便風雨七日，佛禪七日，不動不搖，不喘不息，佛意快無極，過七日後，風雨便止。
translation: When the dragon emerged from the water to serve the Buddha, it rained for seven days. For seven days, the Buddha meditated without moving or shaking, without panting or calming, and with supreme pleasure, and after seven days, the wind and rain stopped.

source_sentence: 佛用初得道故，歡喜不食七日，龍見佛歡喜，侍佛亦不食七日。
translation: For seven days, the Buddha rejoiced and refrained from eating because he had first attained enlightenment, and the dragon rejoiced at the sight of the Buddha and refrained from eating for seven days while serving him.

source_sentence: 七日竟，佛自覺，龍便以作年少婆羅門，長跪叉手，問佛言：「得無寒，得無熱，得無為蟲蛾蚊虻所嬈？」
translation: When the seven days were up, the Buddha himself realized that the dragon then took the form of a young Brāhmaṇa, knelt down long with his palms together, and asked the Buddha, "Have you attained freedom from cold, freedom from heat, and freedom from being hounded by insects, moths, and gnats?"

source_sentence: 佛報言：「經說言：『人在屏處快』，昔者所聞，今我皆以，更見之是快；居世間不為人所嬈亦快；不嬈世間人，及蜎飛蠕動之類亦快；過度，不復作世間人、不復作天亦快；無有瞋恚婬泆亦快；於世間得佛泥洹之道亦快。」
translation: The Buddha replied, "The sūtras say, 'It's pleasant to be in a sheltered place,' and what I heard in the past and what I've heard now is pleasant to see again; it's pleasant to live in the world and not be beguiled by people; it's pleasant to not beguile worldly people or wriggling things; it's pleasant to pass away and not become a worldly person or a god; it's pleasant to be free of anger and lust; and it's pleasant to attain the path of nirvāṇa as a buddha in the world."

source_sentence: 龍白佛言：「從今以去，我自歸佛，自歸經。」
translation: The dragon said to the Buddha, "From now on, I'll take refuge in the Buddha and the sūtras."

source_sentence: 佛語龍言：「比後當有眾阿羅漢、比丘僧，汝亦當復務自歸之。」
translation: The Buddha said to the dragon, "It's likely that there will be many arhats and monks, and you will again make sure to take refuge in them."

source_sentence: 畜生中，文隣為於前自歸佛，佛神通洞達，諸天集會，皆稽首前謁。
translation: Among the animals, Mañjuśrī was the one who had previously given himself to the Buddha, and the Buddha's superknowledge was so insightful that the gods assembled there all bowed their heads and approached him.

source_sentence: 佛閑居實處，精念：「天下眾善悼哀萬民，意欲教之，當先教誰？
translation: The Buddha was staying in his true abode, and he was intently thinking, "Who are the good people of the world who mourn for the loss of all the people they want to teach, and whom should they teach first?

source_sentence: 吾王遣五人侍我，五人不能及我，今在水上，吾當先教之。」
translation: My king sent five men to serve me, but they were unable to reach me. Now, while they are on the water, I will teach them first."

source_sentence: 佛即復故道而還。
translation: The Buddha then returned on the same path.

source_sentence: 五人遙見佛來，不知何人，自相謂：「是人來者，慎無作禮，慎無與語。」
translation: When the five men saw the Buddha coming from a distance, they didn't know who it was and said to each other, "That person coming here, be careful not to make obeisance and be careful not to say anything to him."

source_sentence: 五人皆言：「可！」
translation: The five men all said, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 佛遙聞五人所道者。
translation: The Buddha heard from afar about the five people who were on the path.

source_sentence: 佛至，五人皆惶怖，前為佛作禮。
translation: When the Buddha arrived, the five men were frightened and bowed before him.

source_sentence: 佛言：「卿等五人，何故無堅心耶？
translation: The Buddha said, "Why don't you five people have a resolute mind?

source_sentence: 屬自相謂：『是人來者，慎無作禮』，今何故作禮？」
translation: They say to each other, 'This person came, so be careful not to make obeisance,' but why would he make obeisance now?"

source_sentence: 五人不敢復語。
translation: The five men didn't dare to say anything again.

source_sentence: 佛將五人俱去，行數日，佛以手摩五人頭鬚，皆為沙門。
translation: The Buddha took them all away and went on for several days, then he put his hand on the heads and beards of five people, and they all became ascetics.

source_sentence: 有三道人，各教授弟子，一道人教五百弟子；一道人者，教三百弟子；一道人者，教二百弟子，凡為千人。
translation: There were three people of the Way who each taught his disciples, one who taught 500 disciples, one who taught 300 disciples, and one who taught 200 disciples, or a thousand people.

source_sentence: 佛將五沙門，到三道人所，諸弟子，皆大喜，皆隨佛而去。
translation: When the Buddha sent the five ascetics to the three men of the Way, the disciples were overjoyed and all followed him.

source_sentence: 佛將諸弟子，行至諸國，到城門，鐘鼓自作聲，琴瑟自鳴；病者得愈，老更少，盲者得視，聾者得聽，傴者得伸，跛者得行；百獸相和悲鳴；諸天飛來散花，作樂其上。
translation: As the Buddha led his disciples on a journey to the countries and reached the city gates, bells and drums sounded by themselves, lutes played by themselves; the sick were healed, the elderly grew young, the blind were made to see, the deaf were made to hear, the slender were made to stretch, and the lame were made to walk; a hundred animals roared in harmony and lamentation; and gods flew in to scatter flowers and make merry above them.

source_sentence: 佛光照無數天，其領三千日月，萬二千天地，皆屬焉。
translation: The Buddha's light shines in countless heavens, leading them to 3,000 suns and moons and 12,000 heavens and earth, all of which belong to him.

source_sentence: 前後教授弟子，教數千萬億人，皆得道度世。
translation: He teaches his disciples and teaches hundreds of thousands of millions of people, and they all attain enlightenment and deliverance.

source_sentence: 異出菩薩本起經
translation: Bianzhu pusa benqi jing
